meanings.definition: To represent in bodily or material form
meanings.sent1: The statue was embodying the bravery of the hero in its strong stance.
meanings.sent2: She did a great job embodying the character's emotions in her performance.
meanings.sent3: The cake decorator had fun embodying a unicorn out of frosting.
meanings.sent4: The artist was embodying the essence of nature in her landscape painting.
meanings.sent5: The dancer was embodying the spirit of the music with her graceful movements.

meanings.definition: To express or exemplify in concrete form
meanings.sent1: His actions were embodying his commitment to the cause.
meanings.sent2: The architect was embodying his vision in the new building design.
meanings.sent3: The children were embodying a pretend adventure in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was embodying pure joy at the surprise party.
meanings.sent5: The photograph was embodying the beauty of the sunset captured.

meanings.definition: To include or contain as a constituent part
meanings.sent1: The recipe was embodying all the flavors of a traditional dish.
meanings.sent2: The report was embodying the latest research findings.
meanings.sent3: The backpack was embodying all the necessary supplies for the hike.
meanings.sent4: His speech was embodying the key points of the presentation.
meanings.sent5: The playlist was embodying a mix of different music genres.
